action.action-desc: Mr. Deluzio introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to permit the Secretary of Defense to carry out certain environmental restoration projects at facilities of the National Guard and the Air National Guard.

section.header: Equivalent authority to carry out certain projects at facilities of the National Guard and the Air National Guard

subsection.text: Paragraph (4) of section 2700 of title 10, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking owned and operated by a State when such land is; and
by striking even though such land is not under the jurisdiction of the Department of Defense and inserting:

subparagraph.text: the owner or operator of the facility; or
whether the facility is under the jurisdiction of the Department of Defense or a military department.

subsection.header: Inclusion under defense environmental restoration program
subsection.text: Section 2701 of title 10, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1) of subsection (a), by striking State-owned;
in subparagraph (D) of subsection (c)(1), by striking State-owned; and
in paragraph (1) of subsection (d) by inserting or at a National Guard facility after Secretary’s jurisdiction.

subsection.text: Section 2703(g)(1) of such title is amended by inserting , a National Guard facility, after Department of Defense.

paragraph.text: Section 2707 of such title is amended by striking subsection (e).

Section 345(f)(1) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2022 (Public Law 117–81; 135 Stat. 1646; 10 U.S.C. 2715 note) is amended by striking facility where military activities are conducted by the National Guard of a State pursuant to section 2707(e) of title 10, United States Code and inserting National Guard Facility, as such term is defined in section 2700 of title 10, United States Code.
